H0.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Plimsoll Mark

H1.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Waterline

H2.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Draft Line

H3.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Load-Line

A4.text: The load line is also known as the Plimsoll line.

A5.text: The load line is a waterline that corresponds to the maximum draft of the ship.

A6.text: The load line indicates the legal limit to which a ship may be loaded.

A7.text: Waterlines are a class of ships lines used to denote the shape of a hull.

A8.text: The hull markings may be accompanied by international load line markings.

A9.text: The draft marks are markings and numbers located on both sides of aodia vessel, indicating the distance from the marking to the keel.
